39137511.review:
Came for the Neps, stayed for the actual gameplay.
Game is alot of fun. I´ll tell you why.

1.) Gameplay
Gameplay is easy to describe. You have three options to attack. Normal attack, hard attack and your special moves. At some point you can Transform into your HDD form, which makes you stronger. You just have to beat the enemys and / or finish the clear condition. You can´t do anything wrong. No fancy combos (it has combos but I dont want to call them that).

2.) Story
The story is somewhat ok. The usual "Something bad is in town and we have to kill it". I skipped alot of dialogue becuase it was sometimes real annoying. Decide that for yourself how you want to rate it but I assume that you dont play Hack n Slash because of the big storys.

3.) Graphics
It is what you expect from an anime-style game: simple, not much details. I don´t wanna say it´s bad but yee... Let´s keep it at that.

4.) Sound
Musik is great. I really enjoy the music. And the game has alot of music from other Neptunia games.
Soundeffects is a diffrent story. I´d say they´re real annoying after a while, mostly because it just repeats over and over again. Nep Jr. and Uni are the worst when it comes to effect sounds.
Voice acting is like in other Neptunia games really good (my opinion). I also don´t think that you have to use japanese voice for the full experience, english is real nice too.

5.) Controls
Controls are real nice overall. Only two things i didn´t really like:
Camera is absolut terrible. I just hate it.
No native PS4-Controller support. Had to use third-party software to emulate an Xbox controler (DS4 Windows)

6.) Conclusion
I´d say 7/10 if you like the Hack n Slash genre, 4/10 if you´re new to the Neptunia Series.
Got it for ~3€ in the sale. For this price it´s just fine. Would say that 27,99€ (regular price) is way too high considering what you actually get. Sorry Idea Factory but thats just too much.

39040355.review:
Neptunia U is without a doubt one the weakest entries in the Neptunia series, but that is to be expected of a spin-off. This one (along with Megatagmention, which is very similar) was clearly made with Neptunia fans in mind. The plot revolves two reporters (based on Japanese news and magazines) and the goddesses of Hyperdimension Neptunia 1 and 2 (it is recommended that you play through both of those games before this one) completing quests. Things don't really pick up from there which is a real letdown considering how entertaining the stories in the mainline games have been. From the start, it is clear this is not a plot heavy game. On the bright side, the dialogue in cutscenes is as great as ever and new characters fit right in with the cast.

The game is a good way to kill some time, and all the characters have different moves and a different feel, giving you enough variety to find a character that you'll like. but because things can drag on and on and get repetitive (you'll spend most of the time defeating enemies in an arena), this game is hard to play for long periods. There isn't anything that can be considered complex or hard to learn and its mechanics are very well explained, so players should be able to learn very quickly.  The game's main gimmick, the Costume Break (clothes tear after taking too much damage) can a bit awkward, especially when considering the appearance and ages of some of the characters. If this is something that bothers you, "fanservice-free" outfits that don't tear are available as unlockables very early on.

My biggest complaint about the game lies in the Irregular Quest missions, which do not tell you what your objective is and then require you to lose the battle in order to receive a hint as to what that mission's objective is. This is seriously unneeded and just make things inconvient. Another major issue is that the game will constantly crash every 15 to 20 minutes on some computers. This can easily be fixed permanently with a bit of research, so I do not see it as something that should hurt your experience. 

If you can get the game on sale (it's very low in price during Steam sales), I highly recommend it, as it is a great way to kill some time, but I would also avoid buying at full price due to it's simplicity.

38995208.review:
Well, for starters -- this is a Neptunia game. If you don't know what that means in terms of setting and characters you should probably look at the main JRPG series first. This is a spinoff which isn't considered canon -- but it could very well be since it's not reshaping Gamindustri in any way.

Also, this is a Neptunia game, using IF's patented(?) technique of asset-reuse. It has considerably less story than the main games (if you can even call it a story -- I haven't finished the game yet). 

On the positive side, the lack of story means fewer visual-novel style dialogues and much less childish brabbling. Compared to Re:Birth3, the visual novel parts are generally better -- all of them are voice acted, there can be more than 2 portraits on screen, and they move around a bit to indicate who's talking.

On the negative side, the lack of story also means considerably less Neptunia humor. The 4th wall is only getting a light beating, and there isn't much in terms of gaming or console references.

Gameplay is nothing special. This is an action game, so it's basically button mashing your light and heavy attacks along with combos thereof, moving around, possibly firing an SP skill every once in a while. You fill an EXE gauge by killing stuff which lets you go into HDD eventually which depletes the gauge over time, or when you fire your EXE skill -- which, contrary to the SP skills, very much feel like "press button to win", especially when you do it for the final boss.

You take 2 characters into battle that you can switch around; other characters do NOT gain experience so you need to use all your characters to level them. There is a Lily system, which provides some passive bonuses. The passive character heals over time, and gains points for EXE  faster.

Characters feel reasonably different, even Rom and Ram (although I do have to admit that I need to fire a heavy attack at the beginning to figure out which of the two I'm playing :-)). You can even "feel" Blancs hammer being heavy compared to the lighter attacks from other characters.

Missions aka quests are basically always of the "kill trashmobs first, then kill boss(es)" type. Locales are familiar, except that they are much more restrictive as the fights are arena-style.

Playable characters are the 4 main CPUs, the candidates, and 2 characters that I think have been created for this game (Dengekiko and Famitsu). As for the main story, no other characters appear, although there are a few "guest" appearances post game.

Talking about postgame, there will be a couple additional quests, and two additional game modes. The Gauntlet is just rubbish, while Neptral Tower is a grindfest of levels to beat.

The upgrade path is tied to medals obtained from monster killing, so depending on how you look at it you don't get much choice, or you can use it to specifically repeat specific missions to gain more medals of a specific type.

Sound is Neptunia. The voice acting is as always, I've heard familiar music tracks, and some that I didn't recgonize (but I haven't played all the main games yet, and I don't necessarily remember all the tracks). I don't know whether there are original tracks,

The game certainly isn't difficult. I found combos to be generally complicated to pull off since it's hard to tell when to press the next button unless there's a signal move like "Hit X until the char dashes, then press Y". But that didn't hurt me at all, and for many characters I'd just spam attacks without paying too much attention to combos at all.

To sum it up, even though the game has been created by a different company, and has different gameplay, Idea Factory has ensured that it IS a Neptunia game through and through.

Although the game is solid enough, I can imagine that there are better games with this kind of gameplay, so the usual caveat applies: if you like to nep-nep your monsters instead of just bashing them, go for it. Maybe wait for a sale, though.
If you can't stand the main Neptunia series, then this game probably won't change your mind.

38957931.review:
DON'T BUY THIS GAME.
It is a completely unplayable PC port.
The default keybindings are unusably odd but good luck changing them, since the keybind settings only lists what the controls would be on a gamepad and not their actual function meaning you'd need to write down or memorize all the imputs on a controller just to change them.
Even if you own a controller, don't buy this game.
This isn't the first PC game I've played which required a gamepad, it is however the first one to both require a controller and have a bug that many people experience that means it will simply NOT REGISTER THAT YOU ARE USING A GAMEPAD.
First thing I did after was plug in my Xbox 360 controller, to find that I still could not select the gamepad option in the menu.
I searched the problem and what did I find? DOZENS of topics from people usingall manner of gamepads (So this bug isn't even limited to just a specific type of controller) experiencing the same problem, people using PS4 and Logitech controllers were able to get things to function using a third part program that makes their gamepad function as an Xbox Controller, but those already using an Xbox Controller have had no such luck, literally rendering the game unplayable.
I spent over half an hour trying to get it to work or trying to rebind the keyboard keys to something playable, but I have officially given up, the only reason I'm not requesting a refund is because it seems that reviews are deleted upon recieving one, and I'd prefer to actually warn people about the utter trash that is this port.

38719854.review:
Great game. First off, it's a Hack and slash spinoff variant of the Turn Based JRPG main series, Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. That being said, it's more for people who have played the main series, or for anyone who just really loves anime/manga. As the title may suggest, a deep story is most definitely not going to be found here, or anywhere within this franchise. Bear in mind, however, that does not mean the game is bad. On the contrary, actually, that's part of what gives this series, and this game, its charm. Just the random silliness and easy-going atmosphere of the game is enough to suck you in for hours, laughing along with whatever nonsensical shenanigans are going on.

Although very simple in principle, the game proves quite challenging if you just grinded one or two characters out and neglected all the others, as there are certain quests that require certain characters, giving the game a more full feeling than if you could just use the same two characters and beat the game in an hour or two.

The music is characteristic of the series, and the graphics are pretty good as well, even featuring a little improvement. The combat system is centered on combinations, but the different tiers of attacks are pretty parallel to those of the main series, which is comforting if you are new to Hack and Slash games.

All in all, it's pretty good. I'd personally pay full price for it, but that's just because I've been a fan of the series for years. That being said, if this is the first game in the franchise you're buying, either start with the main series, or pick this one up on sale.

8.5/10

38559444.review:
Have you ever played Hack and Slash games before? The games where you'll need to fight multiple enemies out from a single quest? (and I mean a [b]LOT[/b] of enemies, emphasis given), button-mashing until your fingers get tired? and you're also an anime fan to start with? Then I suppose this game is a good entry for you, and for the Neptunia series of games as well.

[h1]Welcome to Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed[/h1]
A game, albeit the same series that brought you turn-based RPG games, is now an endless-fighting action RPG game where you're able to defeat monsters in realtime combat. Hence the title...[spoiler]Geez, enough with the Dengekiko/Famitsu references, please...[/spoiler]

This game is a change from the previous Neptunia games, but consider one thing, and it is the repetitiveness of the so-called "Quests" of the game. A person might say it's kind of boring fighting monsters repeatedly while proceeding with the chapters. But once you started playing, it could get pretty addicting.

It's just pure button-mashing. Combo here, combo there. [b]Minch all those enemies into grind beef![/b]

How's the plot, huh? Hmm, isn't this kind of irrelevant to ask for this series to start with? (Yes, this series focuses on the 4th wall breaking rather than the story execution. That's one thing to take note of, if you're still new to the Neptunia series)

Nothing much to say, actually. As an RPG gamer and a player who are into these type of Beat 'em up games, it's a 70/30 for me.

A ver, seamos serios, los Hyperdimension son entretenidos pero no son tan buenos juegos como sus notas parecen indicar, y en este caso es flagrante.

Incluso si eres un fan de la saga, éste no merece la pena. Al menos el número de horas para completarlo es muy inferior a los demás juegos (7 horas en lugar de 25+).

35490056.review:
Got it on sale for around $14. I can't fanthom how this simple and short game can cost $29.99 regular price.

TBH the story was very lacking. The dialogue was mostly driven by the cast's banter with one another and throwing inside jokes. That is fine as it was entertaining and funny, but detracts from the feeling of the imminent danger affecting their world.

The villian doesn't even makes it apperance until you are like 75% done with game's mission. But then again the game didn't take itself seriously, so telling a story was pbly not the developer's focus here.

Stayed for the gameplay tho, it was rather fun buttom mashing through mobs quest after quest. Although it may become reptitive after a few hours.

Final boss fight was very lacking, but was an upgrade from the reptitive mob clearing quets.

34507158.review:
If you like the Neptunia characters and Hack 'n' Slash games, I'd recommend it. Personally, while I love to hack and slash, I'm just a button-masher and don't really care for combos, and the game didn't expect me to. I was easily able to get through the stages, even the ones with thousands of enemies. Don't expect this one to have much of a story though, it's a spin-off for a reason.
If you're a completionist, prepare for some heavy Lily Rank grinding. Don't use the same two characters all the time, you'll hit Lily Rank 10 with them way too soon and there'll be more work later on. Trust me.
And be sure to save often! You don't want the game to crash after a heavy grinding session, just to have all your progress go down the drain, but maybe that's just my paranoia after experiencing this too often.

I've found it to be a fun game to relax with. And listen to sweet sweet Asami Imai's voice.

34389213.review:
Achievements: All possible and easy-- though some require a painful level of grinding.  Through the course of the game, you'll probably have completed roughly 300 missions-- maybe less.  That many missions will have likely unlocked all accessories/gear that the game offers and maxed out every character's level.  The "Lily Lord" achievement requires the beating of an additional ~900 missions or more (45 pairings each requiring around 20 missions to max out).  It's just a bit too much of a grind considering there's nothing else to grind for-- item drops, levels, etc.  

Pros/Cons:
+ Most text is voiced and the voice acting is great.  
+ The artstyle is adorable.  
+ Combat feels pretty fluid and satisfying.
+ The amount of fanservice is adjustable.  
+ There are some fun unlockable abilities/items.
+ Each character feels fairly distinct in terms of combat.

- Every mission is way too alike.  Each quest, with very few exceptions, is essentially 'kill 100+ enemies' or 'kill 100+ enemies then a boss'.  There's no story behind each mission or any unique rewards for completing certain ones.  
- Most missions can be completed by mashing the x button.  There's nothing challenging the player enough to deviate from that strategy.  
- It's common for both characters to be defeated at once since the partner spawns in at the same location the first character just died with no invincibility frames.  
- Though I did get 31 hours out of the game, most of that time was spent achievement grinding.  I'd say, rather generously, that the game's content took me around 10 hours to see.  I don't believe that warrants the $30 pricetag.  
- Though some missions had maps with paths to navigate, the large majority were just simple arenas.  
- Most bosses felt like oversized enemies and could be killed just as simply.  
- It crashed a few times for me.  
- There's no autosave.  

Overall:
Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed gave me a good first impression.  I was charmed by the sequences of visual novel storytelling, and the combat was fluid and fun.  Sadly, though, the game just fell flat.  It felt as if I was just slaughtering foot soldiers in Dynasty Warriors again and again without any major changes or overarching purpose.  At first, I liked that mindlessness, but, for the price, I wanted more.  I wanted more customization, more story, more challenge, more reasons to keep on grinding.  I was not given these things.  With so many great features like the art and voice acting, Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed had so much potential.  Given its overly simple and repetitive nature, I cannot bring myself to recommend this game.  Perhaps bigger fans of the series can find something to redeem it, but I could not.

First Impression No.3: Nepu Nepu no Rulu Burekaaaa!!!

This is maybe so late to review, but as a "casual-gamer" who really likes musou, hack and slash games, this is pretty well. The fight seems smooth on my PC. The model looks nice, as a final farewell to the HyperDimension. The story is really a fatal flaw. I enjoys the Neptunia franchise for not only the action, but a story as well. It is like a switch between a visual novel and a gameplay itself. Which this game lacks it (Comparing it to the other Neptunia games). If you want a great musou game with an interesting story, try Senran Kagura. But I didn't tell you NOT playing ths game though. This is really fun! It has something most of the musou games are missing, difficulty. Just a second looking off the screen and forget to dodge, you may take too much damage that the character (your waifu) can handle. You can use the finishing move, but drains all the gauge. So, not recommending using the finisher. By the way, YOU CAN ONLY PLAY SINGLE PLAYER! So just warn you about the difficulty, lack of character, lack of multiplayer, and the lack of an interesting story (ahem..Fate Extella), but with some sick moves and the smooth animation. 34116207.review:
Hyperdimension Neptunia U is the series first attempt at making a hack 'n' slash game. Which is why, it's understandable that there will be many flaws. But is it worth the price? Well, let me tell you my problem with this game: it's very repetitive and boring.

After you try to use all the characters in this game, then you basically already experience everything that this game has to offer. Every level feel the same, enemies including the mid boss offer little to no challange, and the combo is very simple, you could just spam X and win. The objectives is always the same, "kill a certain amount of enemies" or "kill a mid boss, but to summon the mid boss, you must kill a certain amount of enemies first". And when I say a "certain amount of enemies", I'm talking about 100 to 500 enemies. Which mean you must spam the X or Y button to kill that many cannon fodder enemies until you beat the level.

The main story itself is very short and not very interesting. I think I beat the main story at my 9 hours playtime. Just don't expect the story to be like anything you experience in Re;Birth trilogy or Megadimension.

The game highlighted feature is the cloth tearing feature, which basically make your characters cloth rip after a certain amount of hit. Cool feature, sure, but let's be honest, this feature exist only for fanservice and add little to nothing for the gameplay itself

It's the first hack 'n' slash game in Neptunia franchise, so it's not a surprise to see so many flaws. But I would recommend to everyone who's interested in buying this game to either a) wait for sale, or b) buy Megatagmension Blanc + Neptune instead. Megatagmension is more well done, has more characters and online feature as well (though I doubt anyone is still playing online to this day).

33721101.review:
Playing this game while wearing shimapan pantsu is the only way to truly experience this lewd hack'n slash...

You see, there are people that play Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed, and then there are people who ｐｌａｙ
Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed.

I am apart of the latter, because the way I play this game, is to get dressed up in the most ｋａｗａｉｉoutfit (# of clothing layers optional), and everytime my ｃｏｓｔｕｍｅ is visibly ｄａｍａｇｅｄ in-game, I take off a part of my IRL ｃｏｓｔｕｍｅ, until the in-game character's is completely ｄｅｓｔｒｏｙｅｄ. By then, I am left only in my ｐａｎｔｓｕ~

[spoiler]or am I (^・ω・^ ) ?[/spoiler]

It's fun for the whole family, that's right! Finally a game that gets ｍｏｍ and ｄａｄ offf the couch!

"10/10 - Finally, a game that encouraged me to get naked"
-Ｔｏｍｏ－Ｃｈａｎ

[spoiler]The game was fun too~[/spoiler]
---------------------------------------------------------
[b]Actual Thoughts[/b]

I have played numerous Hyperdimension Neptunia games over the years, including the original releases back on PS3, and to no surprise, as with the other games, Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed reaks of recycled assets and reused content. Given the rate at which Idea Factory releases these games, it is no shocker. Alas this is not my biggest issue with this game.

The hack'n slash gameplay is comparable to DMC 3, albeit a bit more simplified in terms of combos, and it lacks a 'Lock-On' feature. Despite the repetitive nature of hack'n slash games, NepNep U keeps your interest with a combination of gameplay, numerous quests, item management, character skill building, and unlockable weapon upgrades.

The enemies are varried, and there is definitely no shortage of both small enemies and massive boss enemies. The more of a certain kind of enemy you kill, the more upgrades to your characters you can unlock, and you'll still be working on getting that Sword and various other upgrades 10 hours in whilst still holding your interest. 

The sound design, music, and voice acting are all on par with other Hyperdemension Neptunia games, so you can expect reused songs/tracks from other games in the franchise, new and exciting battle tracks, along with some J-Pop thrown in because weeaboos are the target audience of this game, and it is entierly self aware of this fact. All of this is mixed in with the same amazing voice cast from every other NepNep game.

My biggest gripe with NepNep U were the long cutscenes which could last an upward of 15+ minutes. This was a huge problem for me, as it broke up the, 'flow of the game.' Taking long, overexaggerated breaks, with me the Player constantly fighting the urge blow my own brains out all over my couch or smash the controller against my temple until I blacked out. 

My opinion on this matter would be entierly different if the characters had anything interesting to say, but aside from the ocassional well written jab at some other video game property's expense, rarely would I ever laugh, chuckle, or even be remotely invested in what Idea Factory calls a, "Story." Most of the time I would force myself to sit through a cutscene, trying not to skip it, just so I could attempt to grasp what was going on, which in-turn kept me further away from actually 'playing' the game.

You call yourselves Idea Factory? Right? Here's an idea:

[b]Don't just talk about something, SHOW IT![/b]

For a game about supposed 'Journalism,' having it be an integral part of the story, and always showing the characters describe in cutscenes how they're all gathering together to read an article about so-and-so, not once did I ever see anything that resembles a newspaper, magazine, or relevant news bulletin. 

The 'Dengekiko' and 'Famitsu News Flashes' do not count, as the actual text/voice content within them is all copy and pasted numerous times giving the illusion of actual 'content.' They provide no relevant info whatsoever, and only serve as an artificial barrier placed in the game so you have to press 'A' a few times to unlock costumes.

Don't get me wrong, NepNep U is a very fun game, one of my favorites in fact. But don't go in expecting anything at all when it comes to comprehensive or engaging story telling, and don't expect to care about any of the characters or what they're even doing.

Verdict: [b]7/10 Buy it during a sale[/b]

游戏前期挺肝的，虽然是割草游戏，但是老是割一大片的草也是很累的，玩到后期就轻松多了，如果你不是强迫症必须每个人物都要满级的话。（建议首要目标是跟着提示清除new指标就好了，不要刻意为了练级重复刷一个图）。
最重要的是大招帅啊！变身+bgm燃啊！还有什么不玩的理由？

我玩的时候遇到的懵逼的任务：
1、有一个进去只有2个小布丁的任务，你打死其中一个任务会失败，要同时干掉两个才行；
2、后面会遇到无敌的死宅（不破防），这时候常态让他打爆衣，然后马上变身让他再打一次爆衣，然后把三个死宅靠拢在一起直接用个人大招秒杀即可；
3、最后的boss，用组合技破防。

pc移植的主要键位说明：
上下左右WSAD，I（轻击），O（重击），K（跳跃），L（冲刺）；
按着R不动，再对应按OKL这几个键位会出不同的sp技能；
个人大招：Q+I；组合大招（Q+O）；
个人大招和组合技是玩到后面琢磨出来的（之前没有汉化，混杂着手柄和英文玩了半天才试出来的），因为后面会遇到普攻和普通sp技能都没法破防的敌人。
释放出来后我只想说：雾草！原来还有这种操作，真是太帅了！

33656517.review:
4/10 Got boring quick, after 3-5 hours to be exact.  The game feels like the australian version of Idea Factory made it.
Unless you're intending to touch all the games in the franchise, I wouldn't reccommend picking this up.  That is unless it is on sale and you REALLY want to see the cloth-ripping mechanic without using google or youtube.

COMBAT
While transforming gives more options, the command list for every character wasn't all to involving or intricate enough to stay fresh for a long time.  I understand that they have a wide selection of characters + transformations with different combat styles, but I feel like they could've focused more on creating more combo options.  Nevertheless, the combat looks and feels fun, but you'll most likely find yourself repeating the same two-three moves for 3-15 minutes each mission anyways.  On the other hand, they did well in creating fitting and flashy skills, specifically those that were maneuverable such as Famitsu's lobster surfing and Blanc's intense hammer swinging. Unfortunately, that's where I stop talking good about combat.  The EXE or special powers that each character uses, with the exception of Dengekiko's, are pretty much the same all across.  1. Initiate special sequence. 2. Create beam/sphere/tornado/whatevs. 3. Unleash tons of damage through repeated attacks by tornado-ing, flying everywhere and slashing, or some other way.  You might get the impression that it has some variety, but they all have the same premise,.... is what I would say if it wasn't for Dengekiko.  The best character when it comes to both combat, flashy moves, and the best EXE.  Wish I could've played her all the time, but the game forces you to try other characters which I understand.  Dengekiko never got boring and her EXE, when I realised it was [spoiler] Kirito's amazing preformance against Blue Eyes (the minatour), that freaking beyond-cool thing he did where he dual wielded, [/spoiler] I fell in love with her even more (gameplay, not character wise).  If it wasn't enough, her EXE is the only maneuverable one, and did I mention it's FREAKING AWESOME?!

GAMEPLAY
Like previously mentioned, you'll be constantly doing 3-15 minute missions where you repeat combos.  There a few creative missions, but it's only a few.  Once you're done with the story mode which takes about 9+ hours, you'll be given other options which don't sound as awful.  The Gameindustry Gaunlet for instance was an addition I liked.  It lets you fight with only one character against other characters similar to a martial arts tournament.  The other mode is Neptral Tower and is unlocked after testing your might in the gaunlet. It has you do 50 more missions as to reach the top of the tower, 30 sec-1 min each. All in all, repetitive and easily boring.

STORY (Not spoiler if you don't think hard about it)
I would've been fine with there not being a story at all, since the whole game's salepoint IS fanservice through cloth-ripping, but they still tried and did a terrible job at it.  At first they seemed to be going one way.  A character did something shady and you can easily see the story's plotwist, infact, the characters themselves point it out from time to time.  I guess the mission director and story director chatted for a while.  Mission director: "Hey, we're running out of missions, you think you can fit the story with what's left?"  Story director: "Eeeeeeeh, well, if I change the story entirely into something that makes fun of the fact that we even bothered with a story at all, then I guess we'll pull it off alright."  Exactly that happened.

FANSERVICE (Yes, this got it's own paragraph, since it is the salespoint of this game + the only Neptunia, ecchi-combat game)
With the exception of Rom and Ram, well, because they are underaged, the clothe-ripping shots and final product for all characters were of good quality, but it would get extremely awkward when you finished a mission and they did their victory poses half-naked as if they didn't realize they were in such a sad state.  If you wanted even more clothe-ripping, the game gives you easy-rip clothes which react to getting hit once.  Likewise, they also give clothes that don't ever break which, believe it or not, I used on all characters because I'm not sick and respect 2D characters. I'd like to give massive thanks to the genius mind behind creating an exit game option during combat. You can take off the game entirely by opening the menu, scrolling a bit down, and clicking, which is absolutely cconsiderate of the game.

NEPTUNIA FANS
This time around, my fellow Neptunia fans, you get a special section because I felt I needed to address some things.  Like I mentioned, it felt like it was made by australian blah blah blah, and while the characters said some cute/quote worthy things, most of the time it felt like they were out of character.  The best examples are Nepgear wanting to turn herself and sister into robots + turning Uni into a cannon.  Wtf, I know Nepgear gets excited when it comes to machinery, but not to the extent of wanting to govern the world as a cyborg and losing all sense of realism.  Another example is sweet, innnocent, lovely Compa saying "DIE DIE DIE DIE MOUSEY."  The reason she said that was so half-assed too. Nevertheless, if you're willing to spend 5-10 hours of your life to grind lily ranks (or 10 minutes going into youtube), you'll be pleased to hear some absolutely grind worthy interactions between all the characters.

I can't reccomend this to the general public and have a hard time thinking that my response would be that much different to a Neptunia fan.  If you really wanted this game for the fanservice, you're better off watching hentai, the Hyperdimension anime, or at the very least gameplay on youtube.

Coincidentally, I really liked the end credits.  Good, catchy music and more of that fun play on other games using characters from the Neptunia games.  If you aren't playing the game to it's end, you should check it out.

33002073.review:
Virtually it is Musou plus Senran Kagura.

Compa, along with Tamsoft, makes joint effort to enlarge the Neptunia franchise. That's pretty good.

However, possibly out of the lack of budget, they haven't wholeheartedly devoted to the game. And it turns out the game failed to become a decent ARPG, ended up being just a piece of fan-service. And even the fan-service is nowhere near Senran Kagura.

The story itself is shallow, and the gameplay nowhere better. All you need is to go HDD and smash the X button, and constantly move around to let the bodies rest in peace. Yes, the bodies won't disappear as long as you hit them, and thus new enemies won't spawn, which is a pain in the ass.

Can't really blame them for that, they are making progress anyway. Little in Megatagmension, though.

Recommend it for Neptunia fans only.

Nep/10

P.S. No one is on a par with Vert since the Yellow heart is absent.

32720867.review:
The most honest review I can give is this (tl;dr will be below:

I'm a weeb. And I like hack and slash games. Games like Akibastrip or Senran Kagura usually end up being my favorite types of games to spend a summer on. So I did enjoy this. 

But that being said, the characters aren't really too in-depth even on character models. There's not much to "collect" either. Kill hordes of enemies, they drop coins, and those coins offer upgrades, but that's really about it. As far as I can tell, there's not even a shop, and according to the progression screen, I played this game for 2 hours and I'm 15% done. 

Also they talk. Forever. I don't even know what the plot's about at this point because it grew so boring and cumbersome that I started skipping dialogues. Remember: games like Senran and Akibastrip are my favorite. I don't skip dialogues often. But this one, once they start its like they never want to stop. If I had even speedred all the dialogue instead of skipping I'd probably be another hour or two longer in this game just from that.

Long story short, this is a simple time killer. Which is exactly what I wanted and also exactly what I expected. So I enjoyed it. But it's a surface game. There's not a lot of depth or progression as far as anything is concerned. I waited till the Steam summer sale to buy it for like $5 so it was definitely worth the money I spent on it, but I wouldn't recommend paying over 15 for it, let alone the full $30 price tag.



Tl;dr?
Pros: Weeby, hyperdimension neptunia characters, simple, hack and slash. Simple, casual fun with silly strip mechanics of AKibastrip or Senran Kagura games. You don't have to have played previous Hyperdimension games to keep up, but if you do it helps. Funny dialogue and humor, often breaks the 4th wall at times, lots of cultural references to other games and anime.

Cons: Lack of any depth given to characters, combat or plot, LOTS of talking that you're eventually going to just start skipping because it goes on forever. 

Recommendation: Buy on sale if you like very simple hack and slash weeb games like Akibastrip or Senran Kagura, but I don't recommend any one buy it at full price. And I was REALLY hoping I wouldn't feel that way because these types of games are my favorite kinds but I honestly couldn't see myself feeling justified spending over $15 on this (and I have Senran Kagura Peach Beach Splash preordered for my ps4 currently).

[h1] 《HyperdiMan♂sion：NeptuniGay♂Warriors U》	[/h1]
  [b] 超次元游戏·海王♂星：涅普♂无双 U	[/b]是一款由[i] Idea Fantasy♂International	[/i]于2016年3月22日Fa♂行的再次以海王星为主要题材的萌豚摔跤♂游戏，但是在这一款海王星中，游戏玩法与摔跤♂风格将与历来众所周知的海王星大不相同，可以说是产生了质的改变。
[h1] 游戏简介	[/h1]
  虽然这款涅普♂无双在海王星的游戏风格上有着很大的改动，但是主角及人设依然是各位哲学♂家们最喜爱的4位CPU：紫耀の都的妖精兄贵—涅普比利♂（Purple Heart）、黑土大陆的妖精兄贵—诺Van♂露（Black Heart）、绿荫箱庭的妖精兄贵—贝♂露（Green Heart）和白露の滨的妖精兄贵—布吉♂（White Heart）；除此以外，还有两名十分强大♂的新日暮里的香港♂游戏业界记者加入了这场Dark♂冒险：电击子·镰田吾作以及电玩通·马丁想搞。
  整部游戏的故事剧情将围绕着这两名略有名气的香港♂游戏业界记者来展开，透过普通哲学♂家的眼中来看待4位代表不同国家的CPU。不得不说，这样的操作实在是令诸多哲学♂家们眼前一亮。[spoiler]并不禁大喊：“还有这种操作！？”	[/spoiler]
[h1] 游戏特色  	[/h1]
  本格のHack 'n' slash摔跤♂风格与萌豚兄贵风前所未有的结合无疑将带给各位哲学♂家们视觉上与心理上的双重巨大冲击。其中，最吸引人的恐怕就是那最具有无双特色的爆衣♂系统了；随着战斗的持续，兄贵们越战越勇，完成热身后，兄贵们会大喊一声：“Huh？you like♂that huh！？（乖乖♂站好）”，然后撕破自己的CPU防护服，舍弃防御转入强攻以获得超凡的速度与力量。
  在混乱的战场中妖精化，化身守护兄贵在战场上以一敌百、一骑当千，使用各CPU特有的技能、与妖精兄贵的候选人一起Fa♂动强大的百合♂合体技来打败所有的敌人吧~❤

Overall it's a poorly made game and not fun to play at all. Only people who actually like this game are just blind fanboys. 3/10

31352345.review:
Hyperdimension Neptunia U is definitly one of those games where prefrence is a big deal. For me, it just wasn't for me.

First thing I noticed when I first picked it up was the ENG audio. Luckily there is a JAP audio selection in the options menu as well as subtitles. The downside with this is that not everything is subbed. There were several sections in the game where you just had characters speak without subtitles. To me that's a bit annoying, but not a major complaint since their voices are all pretty great.

The battle system feels very repetitive and quite boring actually. You can pretty much grab a character, find one combo that doesn't have a huge idle time afterwards and just repeat. Of course this doesn't work for every stage, but I found this doable through most of it. The character interactions between the characters are great until about hour 8 where you're getting repeats every 20secs or so since it will take almost no time at all to get decent at this game. The real challenges don't come in until after the main story. That's when things get more intense, but even then there is just so little there. 

The story itself isn't very memorable, but it is actually one of the things I like most about the game. It's cute, it's actually written very well, and the small talk between the major events at time are great. There are several refrences to games that came out around U's first release date and boy are they great little refrences. I honestly think this game would have done better as novel compared to a Hack n Slash genre based game.

I could go on to pick small things here and there, but here is my overall opinion.

It's a great game for Neptunia fans, but not a great game for Hack n Slash fanatics. I would not recommend this unless they were a Neptune fan. 

I got this game when it was on sale for about $5 and I would say I would max at $10 for this. So unless you [u]really[/u] want it, don't pay it's current price. If I paid that much for this I would be a bit upset.

31271265.review:
It looks great, it sounds great, its got entertaining brawling, loads of missions, and tons of rewards to earn for bashing more monsters. Stuff ranging from stat buffs that apply across all characters to new weapons and costumes. The combat is a (dumb) blast - its really just mashing out simple combos and dashing around groups of enemies, occasionally broken up by unleashing special moves and swapping characters, until you can transform and then really wreak some havoc on large groups of enemies and bosses - but it is very enjoyable. Sometimes you need more 'Fighting Force' than 'Bayonetta', you know? 

The girls' playstyles are diverse enough and have just enough to learn that you'll have fun experimenting and getting better with each style the more you play. Plus there's enough enemy variety, and there are enough ways to power up, as the game goes on to keep it from getting too repetitive throughout the entire playtime, I think (though the level designs are very simplistic). Its just really well done - the animations are great, knockbacks and hitstuns feel perfect, and there's loads of great Visual FX to provide rewarding feedback to everything you do. All the while, you're fighting to tunes that sound straight out of a Playstation-era Mega Man X title (there's a lot of great stuff here; catchy melodies, good arrangements, high energy stuff. Classic Japanese video game music with a "cyber" veneer).
 
If you're worried about it getting pervy - especially since this game, that heavily advertises its "costume breaking", features lots of characters who are, after all, little girls - fear not! You can adjust... well, everything that may grate. You want to give them unbreakable outfits? Go for it. Wanna mute the voices**? On a character-by-character basis, even. Conversation/dialogue scenes lasting too long? Skip'em. There's a solid amount of "quality-of-life" refinements here, which is great. This is definitely a good "podcast game" - just something to mindlessly play while doing something else, so adjusting your experience a bit is welcome. Just make sure to head into the Options and the SETUP menu (on the World Map screen) to dig into all this stuff as soon as possible. Otherwise you'll miss out on some stuff that would really up your enjoyment of the title early on, including leveling up your characters via the Medal system.

( ** - to be clear, the voice acting is great. The script is generally pretty cute and funny, while the English cast are matched well to their characters and crushes every line. The problem is just that the voices get so repetitive in stages that you're going to want to mute them before the first one is over. Literally, they have to announce every special move they do, as well as throw out the same 3 or 4 quips every few seconds. The dialogue scenes are good, but the in-game just gets too obnoxious.  )

Basically, if you're looking for a fun, flashy time beating the crap out of loads of enemies - one that's still satisfying-to-play and simple-to-grasp (but not AS simplistic as something like arena brawlers Croixleur Sigma or Mitsurugi Kamui Hikae) - this absolutely gets the job done. Its the modern equivalent of a Streets of Rage-type experience, with vibrant candy colors and magical anime girls: sometimes that's all you need ;)

—昭和年间，世嘉平台最良心的游戏商是什么？

—报告，地雷社。

—COMPILE Factory，坐。
　创立至今三十五年，[spoiler]地雷社前身COMPILE创立于1982年[/spoiler]
　请大牌、出手办、钓萌豚、躺着数钱一气呵成，
　是游戏商中的豪杰。
　可惜不适合PC党。
　因为它移植敲辣鸡，
　而且不花够五万不算入坑。[spoiler]超海吧5W梗[/spoiler]

[h1]游戏内容[/h1]
　　布兰最萌！布×贝赛高！
　　以上。以下的都是资源了。[strike]这也算评测？[/strike]

[h1]汉化[/h1]
　　汉化有三大妈和游侠两个版本，都是英翻中。考虑到游侠版的文本生硬到能诱发尴尬癌，所以这里只放三大妈版。好奇游侠版请自行百度。
　　度盘：[url=http://pan.baidu.com/s/1ge4T9i7]Hyperdimension Neptunia U Action Unleashed CHS Patch v2.5-3DM[/url]
　　原链：[url=http://bbs.3dmgame.com/thread-5060244-1-1.html]bbs.3dmgame.com/thread-5060244-1-1.html[/url]

　　把汉化补丁放进游戏根目录，先把启动程序“Neptunia.exe”改名为“Application.exe”，再启动补丁即可（这么做是因为当时的启动程序就叫Application）。之后[u][b]一定记得改回来[/b][/u]，除非你想下次启动时被Steam当成文件缺失再强行更新个几百兆文件的话。

[h1]画面修正[/h1]
　　众所周知《海王星U》诞生于PSV平台，对画面追求不高，[spoiler]再加上受众群体是傻多速的日呆，[/spoiler]移植时并没有考虑PC游戏的惯用设置——简单讲就是本作画面只能调个分辨率……

　　三大妈那个“自调Reshade画质补丁”我打上之后一启动游戏就强退……
　　好在有大佬做了用GeDoSaTo调画质的指南，我也进行了全文翻译：
　　[b][url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=904227047]【指南】Nep锐化！（修正画面模糊）[/url][/b]

[h1]果体MOD[/h1]
　　评测区能找到其他两个果体MOD：一个是黄熊大大放的，只有不到4M的某第一版；另一个是比较完善的1.2版。这个由Undertow论坛的[i]DoctorStar[/i]制作的补丁在16.8.11更新了1.4版，看原作者的描述应该是最终版了。

　　原帖传送门：[url=https://www.undertow.club/threads/hyperdimension-neptunia-u-nude-mod.9264/]Hyperdimension Neptunia U Nude Mod[/url]
　　原帖里[i]DoctorStar[/i]按人物和衣装很详细的细分了整个MOD，当然他也放出了傻瓜整合包。
　　整合包度盘地址：[url=http://pan.baidu.com/s/1c13DILi]DoctorStar's Neptunia U-nDressedV1.4[/url]

　　关于该MOD的具体内容，敬请参看该翻译性指南：
　　[b][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=908087536]【指南】海王星U果体MOD / DoctorStar's NUDE MOD for Hyperdimension Neptunia U[/url][/b]

[h1]其他[/h1]
　　跳过开头游戏商Logo的补丁：[url=http://pan.baidu.com/s/1bo5bIGZ]Neptunia U logo[/url]。IF或地雷社的死忠就不要用了，连造物主的Logo都要跳过还敢说爱他？

　　万一度盘链接坏掉的话，请通知我来修复，或者大可以用原帖里的MEGA网盘链接。只是MEGA网盘在大陆墙的厉害，欧皇也许能裸连，建议挂个VPN或翻墙工具吧。

　　[b]除了开头的段子，本评测还是很认真的(ง •̀_•́)ง。如果你觉得这篇评测有点价值或者有点欢乐，不妨点一哈评价（也欢迎留言），你嗦吼不吼啊( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)[/b]

31154806.review:
If Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed taught me anything about the beat ’em up genre, it’s the importance of audio-visual feedback.

What makes the button mashing madness of 1-vs-100 styled games so satisfying is the spectacle of dashing armies of enemies like leaves in the wind, typically to the tune of roaring rock music complemented by the screams of your fallen foes. Meaty sound effects, kick-ass music, spirited voice acting, and violent, deleterious, larger-than-life attacks are all necessary ingredients for a rousing musou-like experience.

Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed, developed by Tamsoft, the creators of the Senran Kagurafranchise, perfectly highlights the importance of the individual elements that go into a stellar action game. Unfortunately, it highlights them not by being an example of what can be achieved when they come together, but by demonstrating how insipid a game becomes when they do not.


In a world far removed from our own, the console wars waged by hardcore gamers is personified with anime aesthetics and a heavy infusion of moe. Video game consoles and developers take the form of technicolor waifus in a land that is a surreal parody of the gaming landscape: Gamindustri.

From the outset, Neptunia U makes it clear that the game is non-canon, and the story is of little consequence to the overarching plot of the series. The cast of cutesy consoles have been called to defend Gamindustri from a growing monster threat that threatens each of their respective realms, and that’s about as deep as the story gets. The game clearly couldn’t care less about spinning a compelling narrative, instead focusing on the goofy interactions of its characters to fill out the space. Neptunia U never takes itself seriously for even a second, demolishing the fourth wall in the first few moments of the game with tongue in cheeky goofiness.

However, the lackadaisical attitude surrounding the plot seems to have infected other, more crucial aspects of the game.


The game is broken up into missions strewn about the different regions of Gamindustri that all involve doing roughly the same thing: smacking around a bunch of enemies, or collecting some items between smacking around a bunch of enemies. Players may choose two girls to switch between in a mission, or fly solo with a single character. Each character gains experience depending on how much she contributes to wiping out the droves of enemies in a level, and each girl has a set of stats that increase with each level up.

Defeating enemies may sometimes yield enemy-specific medals that are collected to unlock special rewards, like new stat-boosting equipment and better weapons. Annoyingly, the process requires you to select every single batch of coins one by one to see if you’ve reached the next milestone, making it unnecessarily time-consuming and tedious.

Characters have basic combos that are initiated with a sequence of light attacks and topped off with a finisher that changes depending on when you press it in the sequence. Enemies mindlessly surround you in a perfect circle, eagerly waiting to eat the swing of your weapon. Room-clearing special attacks are at your disposal to drop on a whim. All of the pieces are in place for a decent Dynasty Warriors-esque experience.

But then you hit the enemies, and the game’s most glaring flaw is made immediately apparent: the sound effects are essentially broken.


When the swings of your blade aren’t met with jarring silence, they are punctuated with the most underwhelmingly stale sound effects imaginable. Most attacks elicit all of the impact and fanfare of rapping your pencil on a wooden desk, if that, and the rest is even more piddling – even your biggest, most extravagant attacks somehow manage to feel weak and hollow. Much of the audio in combat is dominated by the irritating wails emitted by defeated enemies that don’t quite sound like yelps of defeat, so battles become a nonstop barrage of the same awkward gibberish from beginning to end, with very little audio feedback between them. The soundtrack isn’t terribly memorable, either.

This issue might have been assuaged by a solid combat system, but the gameplay is starved of any interesting features to make it engaging. A few special attacks, an ultimate attack, and a quick dash is all that’s at the player’s disposal. With those tools, it’s just a matter of mindlessly swinging away at the ever-spawning mooks until the game turns off the AI and declares you a success. The practically nonexistent audio feedback, coupled with the limited mechanics, gives the player all of the satisfaction of swinging a weapon through empty air while dying hogs squeal incessantly nearby.


Fortunately, the game looks fairly nice, running at 60 fps on PC. Characters animate as smoothly as they do in Senran Kagura, and the environments are colorful, even if the levels themselves are extremely small. Character portraits in the VN-styled cutscenes are well drawn, and the lip syncing is spot-on for the Japanese dub. When characters take enough damage in battle, their clothing will rip to shreds, triggering a little in-game scene where they recoil in jiggling disbelief, much like they do in Senran.

The particle effects can look nice in combat, and some characters attack with gusto. Sadly, they do little to spice up the dreary boredom of slogging through level after level of muted fighting. Which is a shame, because some obvious care was taken to make the game look nice.


It couldn’t be more obvious that Hypderdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed was made on a crippling budget. The polish and shine of the Senran Kagura games, which Neptunia U apes at every opportunity, is in short supply here. The game simply feels like it was rushed out the door well before it was ready for human consumption. There was potential for a good game here, but atrocious feedback from player input ruins what enjoyment might be had from smacking around legions of dumb enemies. The character interactions can be cute and amusing at times, but they’re only a small diversion from the stale meat of the game.

In short, Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed is like Senran Kagura, but bad. If you need your Nep fix, just watch the cutscenes on YouTube.

— Reposted from LewdGamer.com —

30898664.review:
Ввиду того, что я не играл не в одну серию Нептунии (Fairy Fencer F как jrpg угодил мне куда больше), рассматривать эту игру буду не как фанат, пусть я и знаком с серией за счёт всей той писанины в интернете. Впрочем, серьёзной критики всё равно не будет, благо ожидать сверхъестественного от Idea Factory смысла точно нет.

Итак, игра представляет собой довольно простенький слэшер с локациями и монстрами из предыдущих частей Нептунии, что не удивительно, благо события происходят в том же мире и в тех же дебрях. Боевая система в игре довольно простая, потому можно спокойно наслаждаться игрой, не ломая себе нервы как в каком-нибудь Dark Souls. В целом, без недостатков тоже не обошлось, но тут уже рассмотрим ситуацию детально:
[list]
    [*]Довольно яркая и приятная глазу графика, главгероини и монстры хорошо проработаны + специально для извращенцев есть возможность сломать костюм главгероини, оставив её в очень нескромном прикиде. (Впрочем Green Heart и без того практически раздета). Но без ложки дёгтя тут не обошлось: игровые локации не блещут разнообразием в плане своего содержимого + некоторых может оттолкнуть факт того, что они уже были в предыдущих частях (я в них не играл, так что плевать).
    [*]Слово "простая" по отношения к боевой системе, говорит о быстрой адаптации к ней, а не об отсутствии разнообразия. Каждая героиня (коих тут 10) владеет своим оружием и своим стилем боя, а комбо-атаки пополняются с ростом уровня героинь и ростом взаимоотношений между ними (берём пару на задание и устраиваем [strike]лесбийское шоу[/strike] раздачу звиздюль). Дополнительное разнообразие в боёвку вносит так же превращение главгероинь в их сверхформы, при которых анимации атак заметно меняются, равно как и увеличивается их урон. Кстати, всех игровых тян можно и переодевать, если, конечно, у вас есть для них костюмчики).
    [*]Как вариант для излишней критики: некоторые люди жаловались на малое колличество персонажей и монстров... Серьёзно? Я бы понял, если бы первых тут было всего два-три, а вторых лишь пара однотипных видов, но тут [b]десять[/b] играбельных тян и вполне приличное колличество монстров. Да и какого чёрта критиковать игры за чужую сонливость? Сами вспомните, даже самая лучшая серия слэшеров (Devil May Cry) не столь сильно демонстрировала разнообразие в плане врагов и персонажей, а всё потому, что в слэшерах важен геймплей, а тут и его хватает.
[/list]
В целом, на мой взгляд, игра получилась довольно привлекательной и должна пойти по вкусу как фанатам Нептунии, так и тем, кому Нептуния не угодила как jrpg. Впрочем, извращенцам, любящим яркие игры с привлекательными тян, тоже подойдёт)))

P.S. Ах да... я забыл про сюжет... а что сюжет? Я его не читал. Во время диалогов разглядываю леди Vert, а остального мне не надо)

30765703.review:
Introducing, Hyperdimension Neptunia- Hack and Slash Edition!

Instead of your usual grind for five hours and do an event, you kill everyone in quests to advance the story. It does get boring after a while, though. Unless you're me and just love the feeling of killing everything that moves.

Good stuff:
-Dengekiko and Famitsu, previously only mere chibi characters in cities, are now playable characters. They aren't the best ones, but still interesting.
-HACK AND SLASH GAME!!! Just you, a buddy, a weapon, and a ton of enemies to kill!
-FInal boss in the main story actually isn't Arfoire for once. To be fair though, it's not much better than her.
-So much re;birth1 nostalgia. From the world map the Compa's apartment room at the end of the main story, it'll bring back so many memories.
-The clothes rip! Take enough damage or spam heavy attacks enough, and the clothes will be gone, increasing your crit rate to essentially 100% and giving you a free HDD.

Not so good stuff
-WAY TOO SHORT!!!!! The average Neptunia game takes around 60 hours to finish. This one took a mere 14 or so.
-You only really use two characters. The game still forces you to use others from time to time, but you can pretty much clear the whole game using Neptune and Nepgear. Or just use one person to one man army the level.
-The clothes rip! Putting one in the not so good too because Rom and Ram's clothes also rip, which results in jail time.

Gotta rate this 9/10 cups of pudding. Not long enough.

30506923.review:
Je viens de finir le jeu à 100%, cela aura été long à cause du succès "Lily Lord".

Je suis un gros fan des Hyperdimension Neptunia et celui-ci sort de la catégorie des rpg pour un beat them all ou hack&slash comme vous préférez.

J'ai pu lire dans les commentaires que certains le comparaient à un Senran Kagura en "moins bon" ce qui d'après moi est complètement faux. D'aucuns disent que le gameplay est plus "mou" mais c'est seulement et simplement faire preuve de mauvaise fois, car pour ma part, j'ai trouvé Senran Kagura beaucoup plus rigide et limité dans son gameplay et beaucoup moins agréable par conséquent (surtout dans les déplacements).

Neptunia U est pour moi un très bon beat them all, pas le meilleur certes mais une très bonne expérience de défouloir à la fois mignon car dans l'oeuvre des Hyperdimension avec ses héroines attachantes aux doublages parfaits. L'idée du "costume break" en fonction des dégâts subis est bienvenue en tant que fan service, je l'apprécie à sa juste valeur bien que je déplore la pauvretée des tenue alternatives par rapports à la profusion des précédents volets.

Il y a trois modes de jeux dont deux à débloquer à partir du mode histoire : le mode Gantelet et la Tour de Neptune. 

Le Gantelet est un mode décevant sous la forme d'un tournoi dans une arène où l'on doit enchainer les duels contre les autres héroines seulement les trois modes de difficultés sont trop mal équilibrés, en effet en facile l'ia se fait one-shot, en moyen; c'est un sac de frappe et en difficile c'est l'inverse, disposant de stats amplifiées et d'un contrôle bien maitrisé, elle vous two-shot et c'est vraiment regrettable. Ce mode aurait pût être très sympa s'il avait été plus travaillé or il ne sert qu'à obtenir des items en récompenses (items complètement broken entre-nous pour l'apport de stats).

La Tour de Neptune est un bien meilleur mode. Composée de 50 étages, il vous faudra passer les épreuves de chaque étage pour arrivé au sommet où un gros boss assez bon (si vous y allez pas en surlevel évidemment) et stylé vous attendra. Un très bon endroit pour pex et farmer les médailles qui vous servent à débloquer des récompenses et quelques armes.

Bref un jeu à avoir absolument pour tout fan de HN qui se respecte et pourquoi pas à ceux du genre hack&slash bien qu'il n'est pas le meilleur, il est très loin d'être le pire, tentez votre chance et enjoy.

It has a lot of humor however the story is told in like 2 sentences

Reporter make an Interview and follow the CPUs along some quests
A nonnamed nemesis spawns more monsters -> more quests simply out of boredom
Done

Content:
Story arround 7-8 hrs
50 stage tower for like another 5-7 hrs (climbing it 5x for all 10 characters)
An brawlarena mode with highly broken difficulty.. wimsy = enemy is 1shot while you are like 100shot.. Normal = rly hard  Pro = you are oneshot while the enemy has a ton of hp
Fanservice 24/7

Pro:
- Sideinformations along the story
- Possibility to have a nonfanservice version of your suit (one that cant be destroyed)
- Possibility to have a faster destroyed version (for those that rly want dem fanservice)
- Possibility to have a 24/7 destroyed suit (for dem perv. weebs, kappa)
- Quality bgms
- medium length - its an enjoyable length for a spinoff
- Easy achievements yet some that are a bit challenging (like beating the 50. stageboss with lvl1) and some grinding one (lilyrank)

Con:
- Too much focus on fanservice (not for all a con - for me rather a neutral)

- The HDD form is as always way too broken so that you are basically 24/7 in HDD form instead of regular if possible
- Highly repetitive.. its always kill X - wait for the objective to spawn - kill objective


Its a spinoff therefore not comparable with the original Neptuniaseries

I give it an 75/100

Recommended for fans of the series (best wait for sale though)
Recommended for those that dont know the series ONLY ON SALE

29675072.review:
本作是海王星系列的第一个ACT作品，作为第一个作品，它显得有些稚嫩。本作我想打中评，可惜STEAM没有，就打好评吧~

先说一下优点吧。

1：角色能力移植到位。大家都知道海王星的原作是RPG游戏，而本作是ACT游戏，那么，如何将RPG游戏的技能和能力转变到ACT游戏上就是一个问题了，原作有什么技能，这作也要有什么技能，对不对？能力这种东西，可以加，不能减对不对？我不能买个冰棍回去买到手的时候还是冰棍到家就只剩下一个木棍和一滩水了对不对？本作很不错地把原作的技能还原到了本作上（不过辅助技能并没有还原）。M.P.B.L还是一个能量射线，幻影之舞还是一样的动作不过变成了AOE。

2：音乐。海王星每作的音乐我觉得都是下了功夫的。例如本作的剧情里面最常用的音乐I’m feeling lukcy就带给人一种很轻松的感觉。象征着游戏业界在守护女神战争结束后的一片和平的局面。而四国女神变身的BGM（因为太久没打。记者的BGM记不清了就不说了QWQ），紫国的BGM给我一种感觉是“新和高科技”。而黑国的BGM给我一种“实力过硬，老练”的感觉。白国的BGM给我一种很梦幻的感觉。至于绿国...抱歉我并不是鉴赏音乐的，我只是普通人QWQ，我只听出很滑稽QWQ。

（优点编不出来了QWQ,各位抱歉，我文笔不好QWQ，毕竟我不是学文的QWQ），那就说说缺点...

一些在后代激次元后已经改进的地方我就不说了。我想说一下本作的缺点（激次元未改进或是改进不完善）

1：地图太小。本作的地图基本都是从前作照搬下来的（当然也有不是的）。这里就出现了地雷社的老毛病——一个地图改个名字改下里面的怪就能用个一万次。只是因为U因为每个地图不会重复，所以从改地图名变成了改任务。这就不说了。但是每张地图基本只取了原本地图的一部分导致整场战斗都是在一个小范围里面进行没有那种其他游戏的慢慢深入的刺激感和紧张感（貌似唯一做到这点的仅有天界这张地图，然而天界还是有点小）。个人建议：扩大地图，至少像是原作那个大小，增加像天界那样的慢慢深入的战斗。将敌人刷新点从满地刷改成在不可视位置刷新，这样比较能体现出敌人不断涌来的刺激感和紧张感。打个地方，相信用STEAM的人基本都知道求生之路吧？各位都知道求生的感染者都是在不可视位置刷新。特别是刷尸潮时，那种敌人从四面八方冲来的感觉，想必能给你极好的游戏体验。你再想象一下，如果刷尸潮的时候敌人在你视野内满地刷，东一个西一个的，你是什么感觉？

2.pose单一。本作和原作一样，赢了人物还会摆Pose。但是和原作不同的是，本作的人物仅有一个POSE，各位都知道原作如果你一场战斗赢得很艰难的话人物胜利POSE会改变。同时本作似乎是最引人关注的一点是爆衣。那么，你认为，你的角色在爆衣后胜利，衣服都没了的她会摆出那种一脸骄傲的POSE嘛？难道不是应该害羞的尽力遮住自己的那些部位嘛（相信我，我没污，我是很郑重的QWQ（严肃脸））？

3.诡异的视角（提前申明我没玩过PSV版本的也没用过手柄玩这个所以我也不知道手柄玩是怎么样的，这里只说键盘操作）。本作一个很差劲的地方就是视角问题。本作的视角不会随着你人物视角的转移而转移，一般是可以通过鼠标扯屏幕或者按Q来转向。但是用鼠标效率太低吃力不讨好。而用Q还有一个问题，就是人物大招的按键是Q+I，而单独按I是普攻。这就导致了一个很大的问题，因为普攻是你最常按的键，所以你一般都是随时随地在普攻。那问题就来了，这种快节奏战斗你的操作量是很大的，如果你在攻击的同时你需要转视角，你很可能因为手快同时按到了Q和I，导致你放出大招，结果多半就是你辛辛苦苦存了大半天的能量就清了几个小兵，你的女神化还没了。当然你可能会说平时注意一下按Q的时候松开I就没问题。但是有一些角色有时候是不能松开I的。比如UNI这种可以站桩输出的如果你用UNI在站桩输出的时候需要调视角，你停下了攻击，你就可能让一个或几个怪因在那短短几秒时间没有受到伤害而没有硬直导致它攻击了你。如果那个怪正好是麻醉怪或者是BOSS，就有点爽了，当然如果你在打JJC特别是高难度的，那就更爽了233。

29294683.review:
It might be more appropriate to give this game a 'neutral' rating (yes, I know it's a Nep-Nep game, but hear me out on this one!)

As far as characters, interactions, ect, everything is what you would expect from a Neptunia game: aka, wonderful.  Lighthearted, humorous, interesting, this part is good.  A lot of the music is from other games (a lot of stages and monsters too), but that didn't really bother me: I was happy with that too.  The length of the game was fine for me (whatever my play time is is a good estimate, maybe a little lower because I left the game on sometimes.  I did everything except one notably frustrating achievement, so if you want to do that too, add quite a few hours.)

The combat in the game?  Oh man, this is TEDIOUS and not really that fun.  It's fun for the first couple of hours, and then... it's just tedious.  Literally, you just do the combat so you can get to the next interaction with the characters so you can laugh and be amused.  Everything else in the game is great or good, this is the only thing that isn't... but it IS a big part of the game.  So just be warned.  

Perhaps pick this game up on a sale if you are a Neptunia fan: if you haven't played this series before, I would recommend a different game to start with, and then come back to this one depending on how you liked the other one.

29206790.review:
I'd only give this game a 2.5/10.

Aside from the persisting translation fault (censorship) that plague the series, the story of this game is truthfully pityful and is not worth the money spent to play it. Even more so if you take it's extremely repetitive gameplay into account and the time you'll need to spend to get some of the trophies (after finishing said story). You'll quickly notice that it is just a port of a handheld console game and that this game obviously was only made to suck fan of the series dry of their money.

It's really too bad since this game could have been great with it's switch from RPG to ARPG.




Je ne mettrais pas plus qu'un 2.5/10 à ce jeu.

Outre le défaut de traduction (censure) persistant à toute la série, l'histoire de celui-ci est franchement pitoyable et ne vaut pas l'argent dépensé pour y jouer. Surtout en y ajoutant le gameplay extremement répétitif et la durée nécéssaire à l'obtention de certains succés (une fois l'histoire terminée). On se rend compte rapidement qu'il s'agit d'un portage de jeu de console portable et que ce jeu n'a sans doute était créer que pour pompé le fric des fans de la série.

Ce qui est domage c'est que ce jeu aurait pu être génial avec son passage en Action RPG.

29108524.review:
If you don't mind a more repetitive type of Musou games locked in small arenas and love NepNeps, this game could be fun to beat since you do get funny additions to the NepNep dialogues (not cannon of course), as long as you're not going after achievements or just wanting to max out everything in the game. Reaching max level doesn't need grinding as long as you tackle the post game content, however, reaching max Lily level does require grinding. My play time as of writing this review is 34h, 2/3rd of that being the Lily grind for each character up to level 9. It sucks out the fun since you can't even pretend that you're doing a "new" quest and are just grinding the same stages over and over.

Other than that, the game runs alright, no bugs no glitches no slowdowns, steady 60fps at 1080p with the upscaled Vita graphics that aren't even rendered in 1080p. But it's NepNep, it ain't NepNep if it doesn't look budget. I could swear that all dungeons and models were ripped straight out of the Rebirth series with minor alteration.

So I guess it's a decent purchase during a sale, but wouldn't recommend it outside of sales because it's really budget and doesn't have a lot of good content. But since it's NepNep I'll hit the thumbs up button right away.

28859334.review:
When this got added to steam I was so excited that another Neptunia game was gonna drop I only just got around to playing it as I hadn't finished the others but I am still impressed with this game.

Pros
-A refreshing change from the turn based style from previous entries
-The costume breaks ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) (thx IF)
-English voice lines for every piece of dialouge (Is it just me or in other games they didn't have english lines for some scenes?)
-The new addition of characters (Dengekiko and Famitsu) 
-The monsters get sounds too

Cons
-Pretty short but it is a spinoff so I wasn't expecting 9 chapters like re;birth 3
-The post game content is a cool concept but fairly tedious
-The new addition of Dengekiko and Famitsu (I'm putting this in again as it was nice to see some fresh faces they did fall a little flat)
-The controls for the keybored are terrible (But I have a controller so ha ha ha)

All in all I think Neptunia U is a solid and refreshing entry into the Neptunia series as it brings new characters, places and new gameplay. The porting is well done but not without some control flaws 
7.5/10

28496970.review:
Faz um tempo que não jogo e por isso sem muitas horas do jogo, mas eu acabei vendo umas coisas que já posso fazer meu review sobre:
O jogo é divertido, como um Hack n' Slash ele está bem divertido apesar que por não estar com um controle, eu tenho problemas com a câmera e isso envolve em personagens como a Black Sister e as White Sisters que dependem, de certa forma, da movimentação da câmera.
Eu acabei escolhendo ele para a compra do que o Re:Birth1; nota-se que é meu primeiro jogo da franquia, porém já vi a animação feita há uns anos; pois eu curto Hack n' Slash nesse estilo e parece, até onde sei, as irmas mais novas não são jogáveis no Re:Birth1 parece e as imooutos são as minhas personagens preferidas, principalmente as gêmeas, e eu meio que deixei para comprar os outros da série principal, mas eu achei mesmo que seria até melhor ter o background da série principal para se apoiar nesse jogo e entender até que melhor a história de certa forma.

Eu achei o jogo interessante apesar que ele não tem muita customização em skill, até onde cheguei tenho apenas três skills para cada personagem e se começam com duas, e tem o fator que as escolhas de up de status para cada personagem ficou meio confusa entre subir o ataque e o especial, que não se comenta NADA sobre o que aumenta, porém acredito que sobe o dano da skill e do Hissatsu de cada personagem, mas sem explicações.
Certamente é um jogo mais para quem já é velho conhecido nessa franquia, mas mesmo assim vale a pena de certa forma.

Outra coisa que achei legal é que as duas personagens que não são as deusas ou as imoutos tem uma transformação meio "básica" que só adiciona coisas na aparencia, mas que deixam muito fortes e com bons movimentos, o que da um equilibrio no jogo caso você não queira jogar com as deusas por algum motivo.

Um ponto negativo é que não me parece ter um fator de replay bom em um outro save, tem os dois caminhos que se focam nas deusas ou nas imoutos, mas, tem diferencia na história além do comecinho? Eu não cheguei a ver por não ter zerado, mas me parece que não.
Outro ponto negativo, mas isso é algo mais pessoal, é que são poucas as fases que você vai explorar algum mapa já que muitas vezes o jogo te joga bem na cara dos inimigos e você só tem que matar, mas sem muita exploração em boa parte das missões que joguei até agora.

Mas minha palavra final, o jogo vale a pena se você é fã da franquia, se não a conhece, nem pelo anime, recomendo pegar os da franquia principal que começa no Re:Birth1 e ai ir vendo se você gosta. E claro, é valido para o fanservice também, pena que os das gêmeas elas usam as meias-calças e isso atrapalha um pouco já que elas são as melhores que tem...

28421607.review:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME IF U ARE NOT A FAN OF THE HYPERDIMENSION NEPTUNIA SERIES!!
This is a game made for Hyperdimension Neptunia fans and as a non-fan I didn't really like this game. I missed my chance to refund it cus I totally forgot that i bought it. ;_; And yeah I finished the whole game lol, if I can't refund it, might as well try to enjoy it.

COMBAT
The combat in this game is probably one of it's weakest points which pains me a lot because I bought the game thinking it would at leat have a decent combat system. It felt very stale and repetitive. The game doesn't really encourage you to change up ur attack pattern and even if they did, there just isn't enough attack variety. A lot of time I just find myself spamming the same attack again and again. The combat is boring and it gets worse the moment you get into HDD form since the game just gets a hell lot easier, waaaaay too easy to even gain any sense of accomplishement from it. There is one thing I'll give this game's combat though, and that is it's flashy attacks. The playable character's attacks are flashy, although not he flashiest I've seen. Still it's probably the only redeeming quality for it's combat system.

ENEMIES
There are "some" variety in enemies. Well not really as the attacks of most of the enemies are basically the same and they are terrible. For most of the enemies, there is little to no indication in their animation that they are about to attack. This gives the player close to no time to dodge at all. Sometimes I don't even realise that I've been hit until I look at my health bar. The only indication you get most of the time is just a squeeky sound made by the enemies when they are about to attack. Could it be that they are trying to innovate with their combat system? Nah, I doubt so. And even if it was meant to be that way, they failed MISERABLY.

CHARACTERS
Ok, the characters are pretty good. They all have a wide range of personalities and it's fun to see them interact with each other. This is the first Hyperdimension Neptunia game I've played and man do I like the characters. But come on, it's a game, not an anime, not a book. Games are not meant to be a storytelling medium. Sure they can tell a story but the story should not be the main focus. The story of a game exist to give the player a motivation to play on, it's a tool to support the gameplay and the gameplay just simply isn't good.

UI
The interface isn't bad, it was pretty well designed and i didn't really find any problems navigating through it. The only one complain I have is that they didn't tell me that there was a medal collection. I only figured it out 3/4 through the games. The stat boost from the medals really helps in clearing the levels faster which is just about it. The game was already really easy to begin with, the medals just make it a lot easier. Although, without the medals you're going to find yourself stuck in one area trying to kill the enemies with what little damage you can deal.

OVERALL
I don't hate this game  but I didn't really like it either. As mentioned at the start, this game is made for fans of the Hyperdimension Neptunia series, even if it is a hack and slash. Don't buy the game if you're not a fan, you'll regret it. Trust me, it's not worth it.

28173406.review:
Bom, esse jogo é um spin off da série do Neptunia, de Hack n Slash (na verdade lembra mais um Musou), com elementos de RPG como equipamentos, level, quests, etc.
Uma coisa que eu gostaria de avisar, mesmo com o nome ali em cima "Action", muita gente vem me perguntar se esse Nep é de "turno", não, é um hack n slash, pode comprar sem medo.
Outra coisa que eu queria deixar claro, é que no "How Long to Beat" colocaram que dá para finalizar o jogo em 8 horas... Gente, no Playstation Trophies a votação é de 30~40 horas. Eu fiz 100% da história e da Neptral Tower em 24 horas quando escrevi essa análise, porém não platinei, ainda falta um grind desgramado que segundo os fóruns ainda levaria no mínimo + 8,5 horas de gameplay e uns troféus chatinhos que não estou com saco de fazer agora.
Eu não vou "citar" os defeitos, e sim dizer que todos esses defeitos foram corrigidos na sequência direta do spin off, que é o Megatagmension Blanc + Neptunia Vs Zombies, esse corrigiu todos os erros desse, ele tem mapas maiores, multiplayer, mais personagens, muito mais armas, muito mais itens de customização e muito mais horas de jogo. Porém mesmo tendo já uma versão melhor de um Neptunia "Action", este nunca será obsoleto, por causa do modo história, as próprias referêncas, etc etc e etc. Compre este e o Zombies, e espere o Hype do Cyberdimension Neptunia Online, que será o próximo spin off com gameplay de Ação.

Prós e contras:
+Optmização excelente, roda em qualquer torradeira
+Gráficos bonitos, embora você note um serrilhado que corrigiram no Zombies
+É Neptunia, não tem como não gostar

-Poucos equipamentos em relação aos outros jogos da série
-Pouca customização em relação aos outros jogos da série
-Grind absurdamente chato até para pessoas como eu que adoram um Grind.
-Modo arena que só existe para você pegar 2 troféus, não tem razão nenhuma para existir um modo Arena se o jogo não possui multiplayer.

8/10

28070474.review:
Это не только худшая игра по нептунии из тех, в которые я играл (а играл я во все, включаю PP :_:), но и самый убогий мусоу клон.

Что мы имеем:
-сюжет? Нет. Они даже не пытались. 3 главы по сюжету (в котором смысла нет даже по непским стандартам) проходятся за 2-3 часа. 
Сайд-ивентов немного, а те что есть, убоги до нельзя (особенно новости, которые отличаются всего 2 фразами). 
Фансервис убог, без него можно было бы прекрасно обойтись, но тогда игра стала бы ещё хуже.

-сложность? Нет. Press X to win полностью описывает боевую систему.Ну или Y, в зависимости от перса. Да и враги тут не особо пытаються что-то сделать. Если вы играете с геймпада с турбо режимом, вся игра пройдется зажатием одной кнопки. 
Сюда же относится и баланс которого нет. Всеми игра проходится влегкую, но особенно дальниками (Юни. Ром, Рам). [spoiler] Нептуна 1лвла в соло без урона выносит ласт босса Нептауера за 30 сек, при одевании только акссесуаров на атаку и без использования внутриигровых читов.	[/spoiler] 
Читы, которые открываются после завершения сюжета превращают и без того нулевую сложность в полнейшее безобразие.

-контент? Нет. Сюжетная часть, как писал выше, очень мелкая всего около 15 квестов, проходящиеся за 2-3 часа. Остальное время в этом режиме вы будете гриндить ачивы, т.к. ничего нового не увидете, около 60 однотипных, убогих квестов.
 "10" персов "18 с читами" - это просто фейл, если учесть, что даже в R1 их в 2 раза больше. Хотя это можно даже отнести к плюсу игры, т.к. даже за этих 10 игра быстро надоедает. 
Далее у нас режим турнира, который проходится за 20-30 мин всеми 18 персами (на легкой сложности, на средней и высокой в несколько раз больше, но смысла в этом нет, как и сложности. На про режиме вас убивают с 1-2 ударов на 99 уровне, однако если хотите пройти на нем, вам поможет Ром(hdd), с зажатым Y она пройдет её для вас)
И наконец 50-ти уровневая башня, в который нас снова ждут унылые бои. Проходится меньше чем за час, но для полного прохождения нужно её пройти 5 раз минимум.

В итоге за 13 часов мне осталось пройти ещё 4 раза башню и по пути гриндить оставшиеся ачивки. По прикидке в игре контента на 5 часов, остальные 20-30 гринд лили рангов и ачив. Насчет длс, хоть они и не дороги, их я тоже не рекомендую. Они добавляют коллизей с 10 квестами, в которых довольно много редких мобов для фарма медалек. Но если вы планируете брать 100% ачив, то эти квесты бессмысленны, вы их 100% набьёте по пути  к ней.

Напоследок то что понравилось: EXE-драйвы у некоторых персонажей выглядят куда лучше, чем их оригиналы. Графика в общем стандартная для непы, но тут игра выдает на моем ведре 60 фпс вообще без проседаний, несмотря на кучу спецэффектов и врагов, в отличии от тех же Реберфоф, хотя имеет требования выше моего ведра.

Я взял эту игру по скидке за 182р и она стоит их с натяжкой, жалко 60р за длс, а ведь это почти половина игры. Брать ли за полную цену? Ни в коем случае. Только если вы [strike] больной на голову фа	[/strike]... очень любите данную франшизу.  Платить 500р за однообразный бессмысленный гринд я считаю слишком много.

P.S: Ром вообще ломает игру, не играйте за неё, если не хотите уснуть в первый же час.

The storymode to end game is quite short, if you want to blast through it but post end game content is massive, and if like me you want to 100% this, you will be here for awhile.

The game is grindy, but personally I love it. It is very easy to pick up and go, and post end game opens up versus mode for a league, and then a tower to ascend.

27769027.review:
If you've never played a Hyperdimension Neptunia game, brace yourself. The whole series is a glorious satire of the competition between Microsoft, Sony, Sega, and Nintendo. If you're an otaku and know what Hetalia Axis Powers is, then consider this series the Hetalia of Video Games.

You have the big consoles represented along with their portable counterparts (Microsoft doesn't have a portable counterpart though) and ALL of the characters are portrayed as anime styled girls, some of which obvious jiggle physics (looking at Vert/Green Heart, the XBox representative as the one with the most generous...physics). However, what sets this game apart from the rest, is that it's not a turn based game. Instead it's a hack and slash game similar to Senran Kagura (and even features the costume break mechanic of the latter, only not to such an extreme).

Plot wise, the game takes place during a lull in the fighting of the "Console War" (yeah...dead serious...this is just the beginning), which regularlly rocks the world of Gameindustri (I warned you). Basically it's not some big fate of the universe story. Rather these two journalists named Dengekiko and Famitsu (Blaitant satires of the Dengeki and Famitsu gaming magazines) are trying to write articles on the four consoles and arrange a series of quests to test the main cast and get a good idea of their performance.

The game itself is quite fun and enjoyable. The cutscenes are agonizingly long though but aside from that, the overall game is still fun. The humor is quite well played.

I do recommend you have an XBox controller for this game. It will make gameplay 10x easier than with a mouse and keyboard.

Ответвление к вселенной Hyperdimention neptunia в котором кардинально изменили геймплей [spoiler] Название как бы намекает.	[/spoiler]

[h1] +Плюсы	[/h1]
1)Геймплей - Теперь не придётся шататься ради планов в разные концы Планептуна ради создания [strike] деревянного	[/strike] супер меча. Теперь чтобы получить новое снаряжение, надо убить n-ое кол-во монстров одного типа. (Система медалей "1 монстр - 1 медаль." Также игра превращена в слэшер среднего уровня. [spoiler] Долби одну комбинацию to win	[/spoiler]
2)Дополнительные режимы - Они позволяют растянуть время которое понадобится для платины, но рано или поздно оно тоже надоест.
3)Рвущаяся одежда - Особенность геймплея, которая позволяет раздеть почти догола всех персонажей,а также модификации для одежды (Легкорвущаяся, Стальная, и заранее порванная)
[h1] -Минусы	[/h1]
1)Сюжет - Если в первом Re;birth([url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/veru_veru/recommended/282900/)] Ссылка	[/url]) он всё-таки был интересным,(SPOILER ALERT) [spoiler] то тут он состоит в том что 2 репортёра из враждующих фирм решили взять интервью у богинь(И это весь сюжет.)	[/spoiler]
2)Длительность - Если в основных частях серии можно наиграть сотни часов, но так и не открыть всё что в ней есть, то тут можно пройти за 1-2 вечера, плюс платина , на которую можно потратить неделю.
3)Русификация - Её нет, и скорее всего не будет.

[h1] Итог и оценка:	[/h1]Если бы в стиме была нейтральная оценка, то я бы поставил её, т.к. она достаточно спорная. 
5 Гипер догу из 10
